Again and again has it been demonstrated that manuscript readings, which to our impera fect vision seemed impossible, represent after all what was originally written in ancient texts. Even while the present volume is in preparation, there appears in the Rhetaisches Muscam an article by Birt, wherein he makes it seem proba- ble that scores of manuscript readings in Plautus which editors have considered certainly corrupt, and which most ol them have taken it upon themselves to “emend'' are correct as they stand. Many other supposedly corrupt manuscript readings in Plautus have, during the last few years, been vindicated by the work oi Leo, Skutsch, and other investigators.
